intro: Justicia sarapiquensis, commonly known as the Sarapiquí justicia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces bracted inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
